works.title: Common Practice Elements in Treatment Programs for Adolescents with Externalizing and Internalizing Problems: A Meta-Analysis
works.abstract: There is a pressing need for effective interventions targeting mental disorders for service-involved youth across child welfare, correctional and mental health residential settings. Identifying effective common practice elements (CPEs) is a promising direction toward developing effective, flexible, and feasible therapeutic interventions. The aims o...

works.title: Review: Striving for happily ever after – supportive interventions for youth leaving residential placement – a systematic review
works.abstract:
Background: 
Youth who reenter communities after forensic or residential care are overrepresented in prevalence rates for mental disorders, delinquency, incarceration, low academic achievement, and unemployment. Supportive interventions that aid youth in the reentry to their communities can be crucial for successful reintegration. In systematic rev...
